Key Match Events: Wales led 2-0 at half-time but were pegged back by Iceland
Orri Oskarsson smashed the crossbar from 20 yards and Jon Thorsteinsson struck a post as Wales rather fortuitously extended their unbeaten Nations League start to three games with a 2-2 draw
Pre-Game Insights: Wales began their Nations League campaign with a 0-0 draw against Turkey and a 2-1 victory in Montenegro
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy remained upbeat after the draw, stating that it was a good learning experience for his team
Miscellaneous Highlights: Iceland's comeback deprived Wales of joint top spot in Group B4 as Turkey beat Montenegro 1-0 at home
Others: Wales will be without Brennan Johnson and Jordan James due to suspension, adding to a worrying absentee list with skipper Aaron Ramsey, Ethan Ampadu and Daniel James sidelined by injury
